Title: Fire in creosote impregnation plant
LessonsLearned: <font face="times new roman" size="3"><b>Emergency response</b></font><font face="times new roman" size="3">Positive experience</font><ul><li><font face="times new roman" size="3">Knowledge of the site. Use staff from the site as consultancy under the operation (and preferably with knowledge from fire fighting, for instance part-time fire fighters). </font></li><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><font size="3"><font face="times new roman">Capacity to take care of water <span lang="EN-US" style='mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'>from fire fighting to avoid it spreading to soil. </span></font></font></span></span></li></ul><font face="times new roman" size="3">Developements</font><ul><li><font face="times new roman" size="3">Fast cooling of the fire with automatic sprinkling systems or first response in order to prevent the fire from spreading.</font></li><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><font face="times new roman"><font size="3">Gathering of resources of the fire fighting capacity early to a mustering of strength in order to extinguish/reduce the fire.</font> </font></span></span></li><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='font-size: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman">Store personel equipment for the company's own fire fighters on site (they are also the communitys part-time fire fighters).</font></span></span></span></li></ul><font face="times new roman" size="3"><b>Barriers</b></font><font face="times new roman" size="3">Positive experience</font><ul><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><font face="times new roman"><font size="3">Embankment around the building and the capacity of the pools under the impregnation plant made it possible to collect the <span lang="EN-US" style='mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'>water from fire fighting and the creosote oil. </span></font></font></span></span></li></ul><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman" size="3">Developements</font></span></span></span><ul><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman" size="3">Fast cooling of the fire with automatic sprinkling systems or first response in order to prevent the fire from spreading.</font></span></span></span></li><li><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='font-size: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman">Separation of possible ignition sources, i.e. electrical equipment, from other processes.</font></span></span></span></li></ul><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='font-size: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman"><b>Environmental issues</b></font><ul><li><font face="times new roman">A strategy or plan for environmental soil sampling is important. It could be useful to take soil samplings before an accident on strategic points in order to have a zero value to compare with when doing soil sampling after an accident. </font></li></ul><font face="times new roman"><b>Insurances</b></font><ul><li><font face="times new roman">The importance for a company to have insurance against disruption of production and the risk of damage to outsiders or third persons. </font></li><li><font face="times new roman">The importance of the insurance company decision regarding installation of prevention measures and their judgement of risk. </font></li></ul></span><br></span><br></span><br><span class="tsl-group"><span class="tsl"><span lang="EN-US" style='font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif"; font-size: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'></span> </span></span><br>
EmergencyResponce_Descr: <font size="3"><font face="times new roman">​At most 35 fire fighters were on the site at the same time. Capacity of vacuum trucks to take care of the </font><span lang="EN-US" style='font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif"; mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'><font face="times new roman">water from fire fighting and other substances were involved in the fire fighting.</font>  </span></font>

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

AccidentDescription: <font size="2"><font face="times new roman" size="3">A fire started in the creosote impregnation plant, sometime before 09:57 on Sunday the 24th of May 2015. This is where the impregnation of power and telephone poles normally takes place. The automatic fire alarm went off to the SOS Alarm Centre who alarmed the emergency response. Approximately 200 (metric) tons creosote oil was stored in the impregnation plant together with equipment for running the impregnation process such as (pressurized) impregnation cylinders,  transport pumps, vacuum pumps, pipes etc. The fire was extensive and the whole creosote impregnation plant burned down. Parts of the building connected to the impregnation was also ruined and other parts were demolished in order to prevent spreading of the fire. The emergency response services called in several emergency response teams and when the most, there were 35 rescuers from 5 different teams. The fire was fought with water and foam additives. All the <span lang="EN-US" style='mso-bidi-font-size: 11.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;'>water from fire fighting </span> was left in the concrete kasuns/pools that were casted under the impregnation impregnation cylinder. This fire fighting water, totally 841 tons, and 220 tons with unspecified environmentally dangerous building material, was later sent for destruction. An investigation including soil samplings has been made.</font> </font>

ADFireMajors.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADFireInitiating.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADExplosionMajors.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

ADExplosionInitiating.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

Site_Description: <font face="times new roman" size="3">The site is an impregnation plant for impregnation of railways <span class="tsl">sleepers, power and</span> telephone poles and was built 1996. The plant uses 3000 tons/year creosote oil. The site is located a couple kilometers from nearest populated area. A railway main line is situated close to the site.</font>
Installation_Description: <font face="times new roman" size="3">Impregnation unit for Creosote with 2 impregnation cylinders, 4 vacuum pumps, 3 transport pumps, 2 pressure pumps, 3 heat exchangers, 3 storage tanks of 65m3 and 1 of 100m3, more than 230 tons of Creosote oil, 1 fan to send Creosote gas to combustion, condensate pumps, 3 compressor units and 60 pneumatic valves and 100 of meters of pipes.The impregnation plant is built upon a embanked concrete plate. There are also pools for collecting the creosote oil in case of leakage.</font> <font size="1"><br></font>

Description: <font face="times new roman" size="3">Not all of the creosote oil was consumed by the fire. Octowood has retrieved approximately 100 tons.</font>

Causes_Description: <font size="3"><font face="times new roman">The automatic fire alarm went of </font><font face="times new roman">09:57. At this time all the staff were at other places on the site. Afterwards it wasn't possible to find out the causes of the fire.<font size="2"></font></font></font><font size="2"> </font>

CausesHumans.ItemDescription: operator health (includes ailments, intoxication, death, etc.)
wilful disobedience/failure to carry out duties

CausesExternals.ItemDescription: utilities failure (electricity, gas, water, steam air, etc.)

Consequence_Description: <font face="times new roman" size="3">Octowood has transferred production to other sites but has not been able to produce in full capacity. The new rebuilt factory will be ready to be used more than one year after the fire.</font>  <br>

inland: woodland; predominantly or totally natural

EnvironmentalOnSite.Effect: No creosote oil, but small amunts of water from fire fighting were found.

EmergencyResponses.Effect: Company fire fighting vehicle with foam capacity of 0,5 m3.
Municipality rescue service with 35 fire fighters on site at the same time.  Foam capacity of 5,5 m3
